sunday.
bountiful, utah.
2.05 p.m.

i am the only person left alive on the entire planet, or so it seems.
i look up and down mainstreet, which happens to be one of those streets that are psychotically straight as far as the eye can see, and there's not a soul around.
i walk for awhile, there's two kids in their sundy best playing on a spinning bee in the middle of a park that seems to stretch at least a square mile in every direction.
off in the distance a subwoofer blasting mexican music fades into the distance.
even the mexicans are leaving this town.

S.O.S.
S.O.S.
S.O.S.
end transmission

wow. inspiration is a cool thing. *adapted from an improv poem i created earlier in the evening*

hi. my name is shae and i am a recovering poetry addict.

it started innocent enough that's for sure.
i'd only read on weekends and holiday at night in a locked room where no-one could hear me beg for more.
i used to just chew and spit, just to taste you know.
but as time went on i learned that tasting wasn't enough and i had to have more, i'd bite huge chunks of it off and swallow.
in school i started taking it in pill form.
in the locker room before track i would sneak it from my locker and drink it like a poison, i could feel it slide down my throught happy and warm.
it wasn't long before i started smoking it.
great volumes of beat, classic, gothic, and new age vocabulary began to choke the bronchial arteries of my vocal lingustics.
i'd soon start to take it in the bathroom during lunch break.
and i'd go to my next class, not having eaten, mind you, reaking of cassidy and rice and burroughs and poe, and the kids would whisper among themselves "is he allright, look at his face."
i got so bad i used to shoot it in my veins.
i got tracks marks all over my soul and everyone around me became infected by the kind of second hand influence that they'd hit me up for some beau siegh or saul williams.
i'm clean now, better than ever now.
i take a white pill everday.
better than ever now.
i've ben off junk for more than a week.
better than ever now.
and they test me for increased knowledge every day.
better than ever now. or so they tell me.
and i dont even want it...

kay so i lied, i shoot up anthology after anthology in the park everyday. i dont eat at lunch break anymore, i ingest all my lit at night, i dont sleep!
i'll read poetry in public and protest wars and quote george carlin! but i'm not ashamed of it any more!

aw who am i kidding? give me Kaurouc and ginsberg and stuff me so full of poems i cant walk straight. let me smoke the pot of williams and let me shoot the meth of buroughs untill im so teakin and stoned i cant tell up from down, night from day, naked from clothed, or homosexual boy from heterosexual girl!
i'm a poetry junky!
and i have to have poems! 
and i'm not afraid to use/abuse/misuse/deal/buy/trade/or sell them!

*shae

i just spent one of the most boring days of my life doing a job shadow at the utah state film commission. JEEZ! 

okay i read the script for "the crow 4" (wich is actually a really good script, but i dont think it'll be filmed in utah) and catagorized locations, asked how my mentor got his job, and taped pictures to folders. the end.

untill my pretend boss threatends to write me up or dock my immaginary pay.
